Variable Description: Aggression score of partnership
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Aggression score was determined by three questions: (f581) "Does your partner get angry with you?" (f583) "Do you have arguments with and feelings?" and (f585) "Do you get angry with your partner?". The response options for all three questions were "Very often", "Often", "Sometimes", "Rarely" and "Never" with the codes 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 respectively. The codes for the three questions were summed together to calculate the score.

Variable Description: Average time child spent per day doing things by yourself on a typical weekday
ALSPAC Measure: "How much time on average do you spend each day doing things by yourself on a typical weekday?"
Processing Details: The category "Not at all" was collapsed into the "Less than 1 hour" category

Variable Description: Average time child spent per day doing things by yourself on a typical weekend day
ALSPAC Measure: "How much time on average do you spend each day .... with other young people ... on a typical weekend day?"
Processing Details: The category "Not at all" was collapsed into the "Less than 1 hour" category

Variable Description: Child's has any anxiety disorder (DAWBA band prediction)
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Any anxiety disorder was determined using the DAWBA. The child completed the computerised questions and an ordered categorical measure of any anxiety disorder with 6 categories was derived using computer algorithms. The categories are probability bands and indicate the likelihood of the child having any anxiety disorder. The categories range from <0.1% (0.1% children in this band have any anxiety disorder) to > 70% (>70% of children in this band have any anxiety disorder). See Goodman2011 for more details.

Processing Details: ALSPAC codes: A = first or only born. B = second born.

Variable Description: Computer without internet access is in the study child's house but not in the study child's room
ALSPAC Measure:
Which of these things, if any, are (i) more or less permanently in her/his room, (ii) do you have elsewhere in the house, (iii) have you bought in the last 6 months, or
(iv) intend to buy in the next 6 months (You can mark more than one box on each
line) ... computer without internet access?
Processing Details: ALSPAC coded "Have in house" responses as "Yes"

ALSPAC Measure:
Which of these things, if any, are (i) more or less permanently in her/his room, (ii) do you have elsewhere in the house, (iii) have you bought in the last 6 months, or
(iv) intend to buy in the next 6 months (You can mark more than one box on each
line) ... computer with internet access
Processing Details: ALSPAC coded "In his/her room" responses as "Yes"

Variable Description: Computer without internet access is more or less permanently in study child's room
ALSPAC Measure:
"Which of these things, if any, are (i) more or less permanently in her/his room, (ii) do you have elsewhere in the house, (iii) have you bought in the last 6 months, or
(iv) intend to buy in the next 6 months (You can mark more than one box on each
line) ... computer without internet access?"
Processing Details: ALSPAC coded "In his/her room" responses as "Yes"

ALSPAC Measure: Does he/she ...Do creative activities: art acting, music, making things?
Processing Details: The category "Not at all" was collapsed into the "Sometimes" category. The category "Always" was collapsed into the "Often" category.

Variable Description: Child has depression (DAWBA band prediction)
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Depression was determined using the DAWBA. The caregiver completed the computerised questions and an ordered categorical measure of depression with 6 categories was derived using computer algorithms. The categories are probability bands and indicate the likelihood of the child having depression. The categories range from <0.1% (0.1% children in this band have depression) to > 70% (>70% of children in this band have depression). See Goodman2011 for more details.

ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details

The categories are probability bands and indicate the likelihood of the child having depression. Processing Details: Depression was determined using the DAWBA. The caregiver completed the computerised questions and an ordered categorical measure of depression with 6 categories was derived using computer algorithms. The categories are probability bands and indicate the likelihood of the child having any anxiety disorder. The categories range from <0.1% (0.1% children in this band have depression) to > 70% (>70% of children in this band have depression). See Goodman2011 for more details.

Variable Description: Child has depression (DAWBA band prediction)
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Depression was determined using the DAWBA. The child completed the computerised questions and an ordered categorical measure of depression with 6 categories was derived using computer algorithms. The categories are probability bands and indicate the likelihood of the child having depression. The categories range from <0.1% (0.1% children in this band have depression) to > 70% (>70% of children in this band have depression). See Goodman2011 for more details.

Variable Description: Child's depression score on CIS-R.
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Higher scores indicate higher levels of depressive symptomatology.  They were scored following: +1 if less/no enjoyment with life during the past week, +1 if depressed for >3day in past week, +1 if depressed for >3hr in any day of past week, +1 if unable to be cheered up. See CIS-R Descriptive Summary for details.

Variable Description: Child's number of depressive thoughts on CIS-R.
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Higher scores indicate higher levels of depressive thoughts. There were scored following: +1 if feelings of needless guilt, +1 if feelings of low self-esteem, +1 if feelings of hopelessness, +1 if felt that life not worth living, +1 if thought seriously about suicide. See CIS-R Descriptive Summary for details.

Variable Description: Average time child spent per day drawing/making/constructing things on a typical weekday
ALSPAC Measure: How much time on average do you spend each day ... drawing, making, constructing things  ... on a typical weekday?
Processing Details: The categories "1-2 hours" & "3 or more hours" were combined to form the new category "1 or more hours"

Variable Description: Average time child spent per day drawing/making/constructing things on a typical weekend day
ALSPAC Measure: How much time on average do you spend each day ... drawing, making, constructing things  ... on a typical weekend day?
Processing Details: The categories "1-2 hours" & "3 or more hours" were combined to form the new category "1 or more hours"

Variable Description: Partner was emotionally cruel to mother since child was born
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details.
Processing Details: Partner's emotional cruelty was determined from the following question: "Since the baby was born: ... Your partner was emotionally cruel to you?". The responses were: "Yes & affected me alot", "Yes, moderately affected", "Yes, mildly affected", "Yes, but did not affect me" and "No did not happen at all". ALSPAC combined all categories starting "Yes..." to form the new category "Yes" and recoded "No did not happen at all" as "No".

Variable Description: Frequency during the past year study child did exercise
ALSPAC Measure:
During the past year, how often did you do any exercise (going to the gym, brisk
walking or any sports activity)?
Processing Details: None

Variable Description: Frequency TV is on in the afternoons
ALSPAC Measure: Do you usually have the television on ... in the afternoons?
Processing Details: The categories "No hardly ever" & "Don't have a T.V." were combined and recoded to form the new category "Other"

Variable Description: Frequency TV is on in the evenings
ALSPAC Measure: Do you usually have the television on ... in the evenings?
Processing Details: The categories "No hardly ever" & "Don't have a T.V." were combined and recoded to form the new category "Other"

Variable Description: Frequency TV is on in the mornings
ALSPAC Measure: Do you usually have the television on ... in the mornings?
Processing Details: The categories "No hardly ever" & "Don't have a T.V." were combined and recoded to form the new category "Other"

Variable Description: Child has ICD-10 diagnosis of depression
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Calculated from their Revised Computerised Interview Schedule (CIS-R) score. See CIS-R Descriptive Summary for more information.

Variable Description: Child's height (cm)
ALSPAC Measure: Height recorded by clinician.
Processing Details: None

Variable Description: Child's total IQ score on WISC-III
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: The Wechsler Intelligence Scale for children (WISC-III UK) was used to assess cognitive function. See alspac_f08doc for more details or Wechsler, D., Golombok, S., & Rust, J. (1992) WISC-III Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children – Third Edition UK Manual. Sidcup, UK: The Psychological Corporation.

Variable Description: Grouped age of mother at delivery
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: The age of the mother was calculated from the mother's date of birth. To preserve confidentiality ALSPAC does not provide each mother's age. Instead the lower and upper age ranges were grouped

Variable Description: Mother experienced anxiety or 'nerves' since study child was born
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Mother's anxiety was determined from the following question: "Have you had any of the following since the baby was born ... anxiety or 'nerves'?" The responses were: "Yes and consulted doctor", "Yes but did not consult doctor" and "No". ALSPAC combined the categories starting with "Yes.." into the new category "Yes".

Variable Description: Mother experienced anxiety or 'nerves' since study child was 18 months old
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Mother's anxiety was determined from the following question: "Have you had any of the following in the past year ... anxiety or 'nerves'?" The responses were: "Yes and consulted doctor", "Yes but did not consult doctor" and "No". ALSPAC combined the categories starting with "Yes.." into the new category "Yes".

Variable Description: Mother experienced anxiety or 'nerves' since study child was 18 months old
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Mother's anxiety was determined from the following question: "Have you had any of the following since your study child was 18 months old ... anxiety or 'nerves'?" The responses were: "Yes and consulted doctor", "Yes but did not consult doctor" and "No". ALSPAC combined the categories starting with "Yes.." into the new category "Yes". Many mothers only ticked appropriate yes questions, so lack of a tick was coded to "No".

Variable Description: Mother experienced anxiety or 'nerves' since study child was 8 months old
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Mother's anxiety was determined from the following question: "Have you had any of the following since your toddler was 8 months old ... anxiety or 'nerves'?" The responses were: "Yes and consulted doctor", "Yes but did not consult doctor" and "No". ALSPAC combined the categories starting with "Yes.." into the new category "Yes".

Variable Description: Mother's Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS) score.
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Calculated according to the 10-item EPDS scale. Scores range from 0 (not depressed) to 29 (very depressed). See Cox1987 for details.

Variable Description: Mother’s highest educational qualification during pregnancy
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Maternal education was determined from the mother's highest reported educational qualification. In England, Wales and Northern Ireland, the Certificate of Secondary Education (CSE) and O level qualifications were taken at 16 but were replaced by the General Certificate of Secondary Education (GCSE). CSE is equivalent to lower GCSE grades (D-G). O level is equivalent to higher GCSE grades (A-C). A level qualifications were, and continue to be, taken at age 18 in these three parts of the UK. All women who left everything blank were assumed to have no educational qualifications and were combined with the "CSE/none" category. Only those who ticked only ‘not known’ were put as missing. See D1104_C for more details.

Variable Description: Mother's social class during pregnancy.
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details.
Processing Details: To preserve confidentiality ALSPAC does not provide the OPCS job codes for each participant. Instead ALSPAC categorised the data by hand and presented it as occupational classes defined according to current or last occupation using the 1991 British Office of Population and Census Statistics (OPCS) classification. i = professional, etc occupation, ii = managerial or technical occupation, iii (non-manual) = non-manual skilled occupation, iii (manual) = manual skilled occupation, iv = partly skilled occupation, v = unskilled occupation. See OPCS1992 for details.

Variable Description: Child plays a musical instrument
ALSPAC Measure: Do you play a musical instrument?
Processing Details: None

Variable Description: Average time child spent per day playing musical instruments on a typical weekday
ALSPAC Measure: How much time on average do you spend each day... playing musical instruments ... on a typical weekday?
Processing Details: The categories "Less than 1 hour", "1-2 hours" and "3 or more hours" were combined and recoded to form the new category "Any at all"

Variable Description: Average time child spent per day playing musical instruments on a typical weekend day
ALSPAC Measure: How much time on average do you spend each day .... playing musical instruments ... on a typical weekend day?
Processing Details: The categories "Less than 1 hour", "1-2 hours" and "3 or more hours" were combined and recoded to form the new category "Any at all"

Variable Description: Total number of people in study child's household
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Total number in household was determined from three questions. "How many people live in your household now (including yourself) ... i) adults (over 18 years)? ... ii) young adults (16-18 years)? ... iii) children (less than 16 years)?". The three responses were summed together to calculate the total number. Upper total ranges were grouped together into the "9 or more" category.

Variable Description: Average time child spent per day out of doors in summer on a typical weekday
ALSPAC Measure: How much time on average do you spend each day... out of doors in summer ... on a typical weekday?
Processing Details: The categories "Not at all", "Less than 1 hour" and "1-2 hours" were combined and recoded to form the new category "Less than 3 hours"

Variable Description: Average time child spent per day out of doors in summer on a typical weekend day
ALSPAC Measure: How much time on average do you spend each day... out of doors in summer ... on a typical weekend day?
Processing Details: The categories "Not at all", "Less than 1 hour" and "1-2 hours" were combined and recoded to form the new category "Less than 3 hours"

Variable Description: Average time child spent per day out of doors in winter on a typical weekday
ALSPAC Measure: How much time on average do you spend each day... out of doors in winter ... on a typical weekday?
Processing Details: The category "Not at all" was collapsed into the "Less than 1 hour" category

Variable Description: Average time child spent per day out of doors in winter on a typical weekend day
ALSPAC Measure: How much time on average do you spend each day... out of doors in winter ... on a typical weekend day?
Processing Details: The category "Not at all" was collapsed into the "Less than 1 hour" category

Variable Description: Child has used their own mobile phone
ALSPAC Measure: "Have you ever used a mobile phone?"  If no go to Section B on page 5. If yes whose mobile phone have you used ... your very own?
Processing Details: None

Variable Description: Child's panic score on CIS-R.
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Higher scores indicate higher levels of panic symptomatology. They were scored following: +1 if panic occurred once in past week, +1 if panic occurred more than once in past week, +1 if panic attack lasted longer than 10 mins, +1 if panic attack was very unpleasant. See CIS-R Descriptive Summary for details.

Variable Description: Mother's number of previous pregnancies resulting in either a livebirth or a stillbirth.
Partner's highest educational qualification during pregnancy
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details
Processing Details: Partner's education was determined from the partner's highest reported educational qualification. In England, Wales and Northern Ireland, the Certificate of Secondary Education (CSE) and O level qualifications were taken at 16 but were replaced by the General Certificate of Secondary Education (GCSE). CSE is equivalent to lower GCSE grades (D-G). O level is equivalent to higher GCSE grades (A-C). A level qualifications were, and continue to be, taken at age 18 in these three parts of the UK. Partners who were reported to have no qualifications were collapsed into the "CSE" category. See alspac_cdoc for more details.

ALSPAC Measure: Does the biological (natural) father of the study child live with the study child?

ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details.
Processing Details: To preserve confidentiality ALSPAC does not provide the OPCS job codes for each participant. Instead ALSPAC categorised the data by hand and presented it as occupational classes defined according to current or last occupation using the 1991 British Office of Population and Census Statistics (OPCS) classification. i = professional, etc occupation, ii = managerial or technical occupation, iii (non-manual) = non-manual skilled occupation, iii (manual) = manual skilled occupation, iv = partly skilled occupation, v = unskilled occupation. See OPCS1992 for details.

Variable Description: Child's primary diagnosis in accordance with ICD-10 criteria.
ALSPAC Measure: Derived by ALSPAC. See Processing Details.
Processing Details: Primary diagnosis was determined using the CIS-R. 0 = none, 1 = mild neurosis, 2 = mild GAD, 3 = OCD, 4 = mixed anxiety and depression, 5 = specific phobia, 6 = social phobia, 7 = agoraphobia, 8 = GAD, 9 = panic disorder, 10 = mild depression, 11 = moderate depression, 12 = severe depression

Processing Details: Secondary diagnosis was determined using the CIS-R. 0 = none, 1 = mild neurosis, 2 = mild GAD, 3 = OCD, 4 = mixed anxiety and depression, 5 = specific phobia, 6 = social phobia, 7 = agoraphobia, 8 = GAD, 9 = panic disorder, 10 = mild depression, 11 = moderate depression, 12 = severe depression
